footnotes.footnote: Fiscal years 2004/05 data.
Fiscal years 2000/01 data.
Fiscal years 1996/97 data.

Data refer to public water supply and public sewage system only. The data were collected through regular statistical annual research of municipal services and reports are partially based on records and documentation, and partially on estimates.
Freshwater abstracted by agriculture, forestry and fishing (ISIC 01-03) is not included.
1991 data.

Total water abstraction refers to water taken from surface and groundwater resources, and it also includes water taken from the water supply projects, such as wastewater treatment and recycling, rainwater collection, seawater desalinization and so on.
Excluding the portion of water abstracted from Modaomen, Mainland China.
Data refer to public supply to all economic activities.
Data refer to Addis Ababa city only.
Data refer to fresh surface water only.
1994 data.
Estimated value.
Data refer to water abstracted by water supply industry.
Totals include the domestic use of geothermal water.
Abstraction from lake Kinneret and groundwater only.
It consists of 823.3 million cubic meters abstracted from all sources and 11.68 million cubic meters abstracted from saline ground water and desalinized.

The total amount of freshwater (surface and groundwater) is equal to 2600 mio m3/y, of which only 2000 mio m3/y are effectively exploitable, whereas only 1250 mio m3/y are being abstracted (by public and private bodies) and are ready for consumption.
Eurostat estimate.
1989 data.
Includes volume of water abstracted by the water supply industry, households, agriculture, forestry and fishing, and manufacturing industries.
1999 estimates.
1993 figure excluding water abstracted for industrial or electrical cooling.

It includes water abstracted by water supply industry, agriculture, forestry and fishing, and the Panama Canal Authority (ACP). The Panama Canal Authority uses large quantity of water for the locks in the canal, and it also generates hydroelectricity and provides water to the national water utility (ISIC 36).
Total drinking water production for the districts of metropolitan Lima (including districts in the province of Lima and the constitutional province of Callao).
Includes water for hydropower generation.
Includes household use of freshwater delivered by the water supply industry only (excludes household self-supply).
Data refer to Serbia and Montenegro.
Excluding agricultural uses besides irrigation.
Includes water abstracted for hydroelectricty production.
Includes abstractions by the water supply industry (ISIC 36) and manufacturing (ISIC 10-33) and electricity (ISIC 351) industries only.
Includes water abstraction by water supply industry, agriculture, forestry and fishing, and manufacturing industries only.
Includes water abstraction by water supply industry only.
Water abstracted from boreholes, springs, and dams is not included.
Data refer to water produced by the National Water and Sewerage Corporation (NWSC). The NWSC only delivers water in larger towns and cities.
Excludes abstraction by households.
England and Wales only.
